member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.GradientBrushApplicator`1.PositionOnGradient(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the position on the gradient for a given point. This method is abstract as it's content depends on the shape of the gradient.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the point.
The y-coordinate of the point.
member.returns: The position the given point has on the gradient. The position is not bound to the [0..1] interval. Values outside of that interval may be treated differently, e.g. for the enum.

member.summary: Render the page to an image file.
member.param: The to render.
The path of the file where the image will be saved.
The format of the image that will be created. If this is (the default), the format is desumed from the extension of the file.
The scale to be used when rasterising the page. This will determine the width and height of the image.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsRawBytes(VectSharp.Page,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Double)
member.summary: Render the page to raw pixel data, in 32bpp RGBA format.
member.param: The to render.
The scale to be used when rasterising the page. This will determine the width and height of the image.
The width of the rendered image.
The height of the rendered image.
The size in bytes of the raw pixel data.
member.returns: A containing a pointer to the raw pixel data, stored in unmanaged memory. Dispose this object to release the unmanaged memory.

The scale to be used when rasterising the page. This will determine the width and height of the image.
The width of the rendered image.
The height of the rendered image.
member.returns: A byte array containing the raw pixel data.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.Rasterise(VectSharp.Graphics,VectSharp.Rectangle,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rasterise a region of a object.

The region of the that will be rasterised.
The scale at which the image will be rendered.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedGIF(VectSharp.Animation,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.GifColorTableMode)
member.summary: Saves the animation to an animated GIF.
member.param: The animation to export.
The scale at which the animation will be rendered.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps). This is capped by the animated GIF specification at 50 fps.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Determines whether a single colour table should be used for the whole image, or if a different colour table should be used for each frame.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedGIF(VectSharp.Animation,System.IO.Stream,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.GifColorTableMode)
member.summary: Saves the animation to an animated GIF stream.
member.param: The animation to export.
The stream on which the animated GIF will be written.
The scale at which the animation will be rendered.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps). This is capped by the animated GIF specification at 50 fps.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Determines whether a single colour table should be used for the whole image, or if a different colour table should be used for each frame.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedGIF(VectSharp.Animation,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,SixLabors.ImageSharp.Formats.Gif.GifColorTableMode)
member.summary: Saves the animation to an animated GIF file.
member.param: The animation to export.
The output file to create.
The scale at which the animation will be rendered.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps). This is capped by the animated GIF specification at 50 fps.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Determines whether a single colour table should be used for the whole image, or if a different colour table should be used for each frame.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedPNG(VectSharp.Animation,System.IO.Stream,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression)
member.summary: Saves the animation to a stream in animated PNG format.
member.param: The animation to export.
The stream on which the animated PNG will be written.
The scale at which the animation will be rendered.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps). This is capped by the animated PNG specification at 90 fps.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
The kind of compression that will be used to reduce file size. Note that if the animation has a transparent background, no compression can be performed, and the value of this parameter is ignored.

member.name: M:VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp.ImageSharpContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedPNG(VectSharp.Animation,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression)
member.summary: Saves the animation to an animated PNG file.
member.param: The animation to export.
The output file to create.
The scale at which the animation will be rendered.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps). This is capped by the animated PNG specification at 90 fps.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
The kind of compression that will be used to reduce file size. Note that if the animation has a transparent background, no compression can be performed, and the value of this parameter is ignored.
